messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] attachments/virus

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/23/01 8:36:53 AM Pacific Daylight Time, vlos@...
writes:

<< As you all know by now, it was a fast moving one. I tried to stop the
messages from going out, but 3 got by me before I could disable it. I'm
sorry.

Valerie Stewart
>>
Glad to hear you got your computer going again and you are back...

Lucy

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] attachments/virus
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone. I was hit with a bad computer virus last Wednesday and my computer was toast until just this morning. I am sorry if anyone else got the virus by
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone. I was hit with a bad computer virus last Wednesday and my
computer was toast until just this morning. I am sorry if anyone else got
the virus by attachments sent through my email.
As you all know by now, it was a fast moving one. I tried to stop the
messages from going out, but 3 got by me before I could disable it. I'm
sorry.

Valerie Stewart

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: attachments
messages.msgSnippet: I got an error message with one of Johanna s e-mails too.  My computer asked if I wanted to view the message in plain text instead and that worked fine. I know
messages.messageBody:
I got an error message with one of Johanna's e-mails too.  My computer asked if I wanted to view the message in plain text instead and that worked fine.
 
I know it won't guarantee that I won't get a virus, but I don't open attachments, even from people I know, unless there is introductory text that makes sense to me.

Mary Ellen
Because the brain is overloaded most of the time
with incoming information, it seems that one of its functions
is to screen out a large proportion of incoming perceptions.
I am also getting a little box that keeps coming up telling me my
computer has commited an illegal act - usually on Johanna's posts
(but not always)

messages.subject: Re: attachments
messages.msgSnippet: ... I am getting these attachments too. I am also getting a little box that keeps coming up telling me my computer has commited an illegal act - usually on
messages.messageBody:
---Date: Thursday, April 19, 2001 11:52 AM
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] attachments
>
>
> I take that back, I got THREE from Johanna, all in
> response to recent posts of mine. None has any text
> but <<check out the attacment>>
>
I am getting these attachments too.
I am also getting a little box that keeps coming up telling me my
computer has commited an illegal act - usually on Johanna's posts
(but not always)
I dont know a great deal about the workings of computers - so this
could just be coincidental.

We also have a virus detector thing on the computer, and it has not
detected any virus.

marianne

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] attachments
messages.msgSnippet: same here and the attatchments are invalid. I m not sure what this hamster thingy is...but I m deleting all msg with that attatchment. Vaughnde Lee Missoula,
messages.messageBody:
same here and the attatchments are invalid. I'm not sure what this hamster thingy is...but I'm deleting all msg with that attatchment.
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana

but <<check out the attacment>>

Nanci K.
